item.title: First Script Auto Logger
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

existingqwer:

For the record though jagex doesn’t detect whether or not you’re acting like a human on the login screen, so you can’t get banned for using bad mouse procedures. It’s just a good habit to use Mouse and MMouse.

Good coding practice at least.

^ That moves the mouse to the coordinates with a randomness of whatever you want and clicks

item.title: First Script Auto Logger
item.dc:creator: @SuperFly SuperFly
item.description:
@SuperFly wrote:

Ok well its really basic and I know some of the mouse movements are not nessesary, but I was messing around with trying to make it look as human as possible. Im pretty sure there are much better mouse procedures than movemousesmooth so any constructive criticizim will be greatly appreciated. Also there must be some better way than using coords.

[code]
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

begin
Wait(1000) random(+125) random (+175)
Movemousesmooth(435,315)
wait(500) random(+250)
Movemousesmooth(425,307)
Wait(500) random(+50) random (+75)
clickmouse(425,307,true)
Wait(1500) random(+125) random(+225)
typesend(‘username’)
typesend(‘password’)
Movemousesmooth(275,307)
wait(500) random(+50) random (+75)
clickmouse(275,307,true)
wait(50)
movemousesmooth(265,315)
end.
[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: June 27, 2007, 10:28:04 PM[/size][hr]I guess Mmouse would be better cause it has a random clicker thingy
^^
Pretty Technical Terms Eh

Read full topic
